instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Machine boots fine.
ASD says battery may not be charging correctly

FAN maxes out and stays there at 6800 rpm always
Installed Hardware monitor

Battery temps : 129 C in hardware monitor
The battery temps are the only temps that are high
all other temps normal



this is a water damaged air
I already:
replaced trackpad, trackpad flex cable
dc in board
flex cable for dc board

Other problems?
<RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR> or <DIODE>D6950</DIODE>?


looking at page 44 sensors
It looks like the transistors like <TRANSISTOR>Q5830</TRANSISTOR> are acting like sensors?
<TRANSISTOR>Q5810</TRANSISTOR>
<TRANSISTOR>Q5830</TRANSISTOR>
<TRANSISTOR>Q5860</TRANSISTOR>
seem to be battery monitor sensors/ddr sensors

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Try disconnecting webcam, J4002...

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: no difference

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Still high fan running without battery?
Run HWMonitor and look at current/voltage sensors.

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I don't have another IO flex cable and the one I have is red on the water damage indicator
I'm going to get another one.

Yes the fan was running high without the battery connected.
[ATTACH type="full" alt="<SIGNAL>SENSORS_1</SIGNAL>.jpg"]59252[/ATTACH] [ATTACH type="full" alt="<SIGNAL>SENSORS_2</SIGNAL>.jpg"]59254[/ATTACH]

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Try known good LIO flex/board.
Inspect J9500 for corrosion.

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Anything else
Page 44?

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Check <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>, its traces and all components related...

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
OK new flex cable and DC in board.
Connected battery.
Boots to OS.

The 128C battery reading is gone.
but
Fan still at 6100 RPM-6300RPM
Machine seems a bit sluggish

[ATTACH type="full" alt="<SIGNAL>TEMP_1</SIGNAL>.jpg"]59258[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full" alt="<SIGNAL>TEMP_2</SIGNAL>.jpg"]59259[/ATTACH]

The PECI SA sensor seems to flip between 0C and 38 C.

Next I will try to use a new trackpad. I used a known working trackpad.

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Try clean ME BIOS.
You should find something posted on the forum.
Try it as is, do not change serial yet...

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I have access to a medusa2
I think that should make it easier for me

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Medusa programmer can clean ME region for you, directly on the MLB...

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Well, I cleaned the ME region
Went well.

Boot up into Catalina but the Battery Temps are back up to 129 C in Hardware monitor
Fan : 6200

All other temps normal.

I had put in a known working used trackpad.

Maybe I will put in a brand new trackpad and see if that works.
The trackpad sensor may be flaky.

I feel I am close to fixing this one but the fan speed and the Battery temp reading is a persistent issue.

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Battery temp sensor is on trackpad board.

Did you try disconnecting webcam?

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
OK webcam disconnected. New trackpad.
Boots into OS.
Still high fan.

I am willing to start over and see what I have missed.
I know this one can be solved.

1) Buy another DC-in board?
2) are there any sensors that are on the board that feed battery temp data?
3) trackpad connector?


1 difference: AIRFLOW sensor reads 128C

[URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-fan-spinning-high.10800/[/URL]

any clues there?

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Did you check all what dukefawks mentioned in that thread?

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Yes I did
EFI diagnostics: no errors except for battery missing (unplugged)

I checked:

J4800 looks good
J9500 looks good

J4800
Diode voltage to ground
16: .71
17: .71


Now I'm wondering if I should just replace <CHIP>U5800</CHIP> but CPU is on other side of board which makes me nervous.

<CHIP>U5810</CHIP>? <----- REPLACE because its on the sensor data line
I checked <RESISTOR>R5390</RESISTOR>/91 voltage diode to ground on pin 2: ~.51V both

I don't get a SMC error on diagnostics but thats my concern since nothing else I have tried is working and these sensor data lines
have no where else to go but the SMC.

Did you replace it?
Is not easy to detect corrosion underneath the connector...

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Yes, just replaced the trackpad connector.
No change. Still boots into OS fine.

Fan starts slow and just ramps up to MAX 6800 RPM.
Battery temps 129C in HWMonitor

I used a trackpad connector from a donor board.

I now am looking at:

<CHIP>U5810</CHIP> 
SMC

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
OK Replaced

<CHIP>U5810</CHIP>
<CHIP>U5620</CHIP>

Re-seated all keyboard/trackpad connectors.
Did an SMC reset


Still have fan at 6300

Airflow TEMP: 128
BAT SENSOR temps: 128

Machine boots into OS
Fan starts slow and as the OS appears the fan ramps up to max speed and stays there.

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Instal Macs Fan Speed and set fan to follow CPU die temp.
See if machine works good then.

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
OK I just did that
Fan instantly dropped to normal speed at around ~1200
Seems to run fine.
Ran fine for 2 hours testing.

Any thing else you can think of to try?

I was hoping to avoid an SMC reball etc.
SMC reflow?

ASD (EFI) shows no SMC error.

AIRFLOW TEMP sensor shows at 128C

Could this be: <TRANSISTOR>Q5830</TRANSISTOR>? bad

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Could be anything on the same bus.
Even PCH can have internal problem, or bad connections on that bus.
Change all is possible.
If still the same, explain to the client how to use the fan control software...

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Ok
Thank You

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
FYI <CHIP>U5660</CHIP> 

Pin 6: 0V on diode mode to ground
<RESISTOR>R5663</RESISTOR> is 13K (schematic says 20K)
<RESISTOR>R5661</RESISTOR>: 15K (schematic says 27K)
<RESISTOR>R5662</RESISTOR>: 1 K
<RESISTOR>R5666</RESISTOR>: 0.4 
<RESISTOR>R5668</RESISTOR>: 0.4

threads.title: Fan speed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
"Pin 6: 0V on diode mode to ground"
That is a problem; change <CHIP>U5660</CHIP>.

Resistors measured onboard will give lower values than expected; depending of nominal value and circuit design.

"<RESISTOR>R5663</RESISTOR> is 13K (schematic says 20K)"
Seems that you've measured this out of board; as you have short on board...
